trans-unit.target:
TEXT_BANMAM102_05262_SEQ_00<tab>Kageel Ja seeks an adventurer willing to soil their hands for the soil.
※Please note that the difficulty of this quest has been synced to your current level. Furthermore, you may not proceed with a class or job different from when you accepted this quest.
TEXT_BANMAM102_05262_TODO_00<tab>Inspect the designated locations for wivre leavings.
TEXT_BANMAM102_05262_TODO_01<tab>Deliver the sacks of wivre leavings to Kubeel Ja.

TEXT_BANMAM102_05262_KAGEELJA_000_000<tab>Ah, what fortuitous timing. We've been meaning to try enriching the fields with manure, you see, and...well... Might I trouble you to gather wivre leavings for us?

TEXT_BANMAM102_05262_KAGEELJA_000_001<tab>Good to see you, my friend. You'll be happy to know the leavings you gathered for us proved more effective than we dared hope. In fact, we're of a mind to try more with different crops. Might I bother you to collect a few more sacks?

TEXT_BANMAM102_05262_KAGEELJA_000_002<tab>You'll not have to look far in the Ja Tiika Heartland. The hunters there looking for mushrooms are, more often than not, accompanied by wivres. Should you see them, you're certain to find all that we need.
TEXT_BANMAM102_05262_KAGEELJA_000_003<tab>Three sacks of leavings should suffice, I think. Once you have them, Kubeel Ja over in Gok Golma will gladly take them off your hands.
TEXT_BANMAM102_05262_CITIZENA05262_000_005<tab>Kageel Ja told me I might find you out here. Well, if it's leavings you want, you're welcome to them. Take as much as you like.
TEXT_BANMAM102_05262_KUBEELJA_100_009<tab>Welcome, friend. Judging by that odor, I take it Kageel Ja sent you?
TEXT_BANMAM102_05262_KUBEELJA_000_012<tab>There it is! Didn't help much with growing the najool, but I can think of a few crops worth trying this with.
TEXT_BANMAM102_05262_KUBEELJA_000_013<tab>Wonderful. I know just where to use this. You have my thanks, friend.
TEXT_BANMAM102_05262_KUBEELJA_000_014<tab>Thanks again for all your help. Give my regards to Kageel Ja, won't you?
TEXT_BANMAM102_05262_KAGEELJA_000_015<tab>You're back! Empty-handed, but you carry the unmistakable smell of a job well done.

TEXT_BANMAM102_05262_KAGEELJA_000_016<tab>Compost made from fallen leaves and such was fine when we only had najool to worry about, but a more diverse selection of crops calls for richer soil. And that's where animal manure comes in.
TEXT_BANMAM102_05262_KAGEELJA_000_017<tab>Dirty business, I know, but a ready supply of leavings is a blessing we can ill afford to ignore.
